entry.title: annoying, colorful bees that collect pesticide (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a malaria-control program in rural Brazil attracted droves of annoying, colorful bees that collect pesticide (example pictured) into homes?

entry.title: Caspar Richter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Caspar Richter co-founded an orchestra in Vienna and conducted it in performances of new musicals including Mozart! and Elisabeth?

entry.title: Fighting Vanguard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Fighting Vanguard waged a guerrilla war against the Syrian government in the 1970s and 1980s?

entry.title: Robert Brigandyne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Brigandyne constructed the first purpose-built dry dock in England, after King Henry VII's new warships grew too big to be repaired on mudbanks?

entry.title: a scene in Better Call Saul (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that actor Jim O'Heir consumed numerous cinnamon rolls for a scene in Better Call Saul?

entry.title: Nieve Ella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the British musician Nieve Ella has a hair salon named after her?

entry.title: Robbery Bob (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a reviewer thought that the video game Robbery Bob contained cringeworthy dialogue?

entry.title: Muhsin Hendricks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Muhsin Hendricks of South Africa has been described as "the world's first openly gay imam"?
